member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.RequestRateController
member.summary: The request controller for Shopify API call, it will use the API call limit data from the Shopify store, allow or prohibit the API request to Shopify store. For restful API request, if the current capacity is available, it will allow the API request to access Shopify store; Otherwise controller will put the request on hold status until capacity is available For graphQL API request, it will allow the request if query cost is less than current available cost points, otherwise controller will put the request on hold status until cost points are available The capacity or cost point will be auto refilled, the rate is different based on the Shopify store plan.

member.summary: For Rest API

member.summary: For GraphQL

member.summary: Update the API call limit data from Shopify GraphQL API response data

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.CustomerDataGQL
member.summary: Represents information about a customer of the shop, such as the customer's contact details, their order history, and whether they've agreed to receive marketing material by email.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.CustomerDataGQL.Addresses
member.summary: A list of addresses associated with the customer.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.CustomerDataGQL.AmountSpent
member.summary: The total amount that the customer has spent on orders in their lifetime.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.CustomerDataGQL.CanDelete
member.summary: Whether the merchant can delete the customer from their store. A customer can be deleted from a store only if they have not yet made an order.After a customer makes an order, they can't be deleted from a store.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.CustomerDataGQL.CompanyContactProfiles
member.summary: A list of the customer's company contact profiles.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.CustomerDataGQL.CreatedAt
member.summary: The date and time when the customer was added to the store.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.CustomerDataGQL.DefaultAddress
member.summary: The default address associated with the customer.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.CustomerDataGQL.DisplayName
member.summary: The full name of the customer, based on the values for first_name and last_name. If the first_name and last_name are not available, then this falls back to the customer's email address, and if that is not available, the customer's phone number.

member.summary: The customer's email address.

member.summary: Attaches additional metadata to a shop's resources: key(required) : An identifier for the metafield(maximum of 30 characters). namespace(required): A container for a set of metadata(maximum of 20 characters). Namespaces help distinguish between metadata that you created and metadata created by another individual with a similar namespace. value (required): Information to be stored as metadata. value_type(required): The value type.Valid values: string and integer. description(optional): Additional information about the metafield.

member.summary: The fulfillment status for the order that can be shown to the merchant. This field does not capture all the details of an order's fulfillment state. It should only be used for display summary purposes. For a more granular view of the fulfillment status, refer to the FulfillmentOrder object.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.OrderDataGQL.MetafieldNodes
member.summary: Attaches additional metadata to a shop's resources: key(required) : An identifier for the metafield(maximum of 30 characters). namespace(required): A container for a set of metadata(maximum of 20 characters). Namespaces help distinguish between metadata that you created and metadata created by another individual with a similar namespace. value (required): Information to be stored as metadata. value_type(required): The value type.Valid values: string and integer. description(optional): Additional information about the metafield.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.OrderRiskGQL.Level
member.summary: The mapping between restful API field Recommendation: accept:low, investigate:medium, cancel:high HIGH: There is a high level of risk that this order is fraudulent. LOW: There is a low level of risk that this order is fraudulent. MEDIUM: There is a medium level of risk that this order is fraudulent.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.PriceListMutation.PriceListFixedPricesAdd
member.summary: Creates or updates fixed prices on a price list. You can use the priceListFixedPricesAdd mutation to set a fixed price for specific product variants. This lets you change product variant pricing on a per country basis. Any existing fixed price list prices for these variants will be overwritten.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.PriceListMutation.PriceListFixedPricesUpdate
member.summary: Updates fixed prices on a price list. You can use the priceListFixedPricesUpdate mutation to set a fixed price for specific product variants or to delete prices for variants associated with the price list.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.PriceListMutation.PriceListFixedPricesDelete
member.summary: Deletes specific fixed prices from a price list using a product variant ID. You can use the priceListFixedPricesDelete mutation to delete a set of fixed prices from a price list. After deleting the set of fixed prices from the price list, the price of each product variant reverts to the original price that was determined by the price list adjustment.

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.FulfillmentGQL
member.summary: Represents a fulfillment. In Shopify, a fulfillment represents a shipment of one or more items in an order. When an order has been completely fulfilled, it means that all the items that are included in the order have been sent to the customer. There can be more than one fulfillment for an order.

member.summary: The FulfillmentOrder resource represents either an item or a group of items in an order that are to be fulfilled from the same location. There can be more than one fulfillment order for an order at a given location.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.FulfillmentOrderGQL.FulfillAt
member.summary: The date and time at which the fulfillment order will be fulfillable. When this date and time is reached, the scheduled fulfillment order is automatically transitioned to open. For example, the fulfill_at date for a subscription order might be the 1st of each month, a pre-order fulfill_at date would be nil, and a standard order fulfill_at date would be the order creation date.

member.summary: Displayed as Fulfilled. All the items in the order have been fulfilled.

member.summary: Displayed as In progress. Some of the items in the order have been fulfilled, or a request for fulfillment has been sent to the fulfillment service.

member.summary: Displayed as On hold. All of the unfulfilled items in this order are on hold.

member.summary: Displayed as Open. None of the items in the order have been fulfilled. Replaced by "UNFULFILLED" status.

member.summary: Displayed as Partially fulfilled. Some of the items in the order have been fulfilled.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.OrderDisplayFulfillmentStatusGQL.PendingFulfillment
member.summary: Displayed as Pending fulfillment. A request for fulfillment of some items awaits a response from the fulfillment service. Replaced by the "IN_PROGRESS" status.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.OrderDisplayFulfillmentStatusGQL.Restocked
member.summary: Displayed as Restocked. All the items in the order have been restocked. Replaced by the "UNFULFILLED" status.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.GraphQL.OrderDisplayFulfillmentStatusGQL.Scheduled
member.summary: Displayed as Scheduled. All of the unfulfilled items in this order are scheduled for fulfillment at a later time.

Customer accounts can be disabled from the Shopify admin at any time. invited: The customer has received an email invite to create an account. enabled: The customer has created an account. declined: The customer declined the email invite to create an account.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerData.TotalSpent
member.summary: The total amount of money that the customer has spent across their order history.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerData.LastOrderId
member.summary: The ID of the customer's last order.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerData.Note
member.summary: A note about the customer.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerData.TaxExempt
member.summary: Whether the customer is exempt from paying taxes on their order. If true, then taxes won't be applied to an order at checkout. If false, then taxes will be applied at checkout.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerData.Phone
member.summary: The unique phone number (E.164 format) for this customer. Attempting to assign the same phone number to multiple customers returns an error. The property can be set using different formats, but each format must represent a number that can be dialed from anywhere in the world. The following formats are all valid: 6135551212, +16135551212, (613)555-1212, +1 613-555-1212

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerData.Tags
member.summary: Tags that the shop owner has attached to the customer, formatted as a string of comma-separated values. A customer can have up to 250 tags. Each tag can have up to 255 characters.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerData.LastOrderName
member.summary: The name of the customer's last order. This is directly related to the name field on the Order resource.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerData.Currency
member.summary: The three-letter code (ISO 4217 format) for the currency that the customer used when they paid for their last order. Defaults to the shop currency. Returns the shop currency for test orders.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerData.TaxExemptions
member.summary: Whether the customer is exempt from paying specific taxes on their order. Canadian taxes only. Valid values: EXEMPT_ALL: This customer is exempt from all Canadian taxes. CA_STATUS_CARD_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid STATUS_CARD_EXEMPTION in Canada. CA_DIPLOMAT_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid DIPLOMAT_EXEMPTION in Canada. CA_BC_RESELLER_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid RESELLER_EXEMPTION in British Columbia. CA_MB_RESELLER_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid RESELLER_EXEMPTION in Manitoba. CA_SK_RESELLER_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid RESELLER_EXEMPTION in Saskatchewan. CA_BC_COMMERCIAL_FISHERY_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid COMMERCIAL_FISHERY_EXEMPTION in British Columbia. CA_MB_COMMERCIAL_FISHERY_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid COMMERCIAL_FISHERY_EXEMPTION in Manitoba. CA_NS_COMMERCIAL_FISHERY_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid COMMERCIAL_FISHERY_EXEMPTION in Nova Scotia. CA_PE_COMMERCIAL_FISHERY_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid COMMERCIAL_FISHERY_EXEMPTION in Prince Edward Island. CA_SK_COMMERCIAL_FISHERY_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid COMMERCIAL_FISHERY_EXEMPTION in Saskatchewan. CA_BC_PRODUCTION_AND_MACHINERY_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid PRODUCTION_AND_MACHINERY_EXEMPTION in British Columbia. CA_SK_PRODUCTION_AND_MACHINERY_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid PRODUCTION_AND_MACHINERY_EXEMPTION in Saskatchewan. CA_BC_SUB_CONTRACTOR_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid SUB_CONTRACTOR_EXEMPTION in British Columbia. CA_SK_SUB_CONTRACTOR_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid SUB_CONTRACTOR_EXEMPTION in Saskatchewan. CA_BC_CONTRACTOR_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid CONTRACTOR_EXEMPTION in British Columbia. CA_SK_CONTRACTOR_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid CONTRACTOR_EXEMPTION in Saskatchewan. CA_ON_PURCHASE_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid PURCHASE_EXEMPTION in Ontario. CA_MB_FARMER_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid FARMER_EXEMPTION in Manitoba. CA_NS_FARMER_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid FARMER_EXEMPTION in Nova Scotia. CA_SK_FARMER_EXEMPTION: This customer is exempt from specific taxes for holding a valid FARMER_EXEMPTION in Saskatchewan.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerData.Addresses
member.summary: A list of the ten most recently updated addresses for the customer.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerData.DefaultAddress
member.summary: The default address for the customer.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerData.Metafields
member.summary: Attaches additional metadata to a shop's resources: key(required) : An identifier for the metafield(maximum of 30 characters). namespace(required): A container for a set of metadata(maximum of 20 characters). Namespaces help distinguish between metadata that you created and metadata created by another individual with a similar namespace. value (required): Information to be stored as metadata. value_type(required): The value type.Valid values: string and integer. description(optional): Additional information about the metafield.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerEmailMarketing.State
member.summary: The current email marketing state for the customer.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerEmailMarketing.Opt_in_level
member.summary: The marketing subscription opt-in level, as described in the M3AAWG Sender Best Common Practices, that the customer gave when they consented to receive marketing material by email.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.CustomerEmailMarketing.Consent_updated_at
member.summary: The date and time when the customer consented to receive marketing material by email. If no date is provided, then the date and time when the consent information was sent is used.

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.DiscountAllocationMethods
member.summary: allocation_method: The method by which the discount application value has been allocated to entitled lines. Valid values: across: The value is spread across all entitled lines. each: The value is applied onto every entitled line. one: The value is applied onto a single line.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.DiscountAllocationMethods.Across
member.summary: across: The value is spread across all entitled lines.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.DiscountAllocationMethods.Each
member.summary: each: The value is applied onto every entitled line.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.DiscountAllocationMethods.One
member.summary: one: The value is applied onto a single line.

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.DiscountApplicationType
member.summary: The discount application type. Valid values: automatic: The discount was applied automatically, such as by a Buy X Get Y automatic discount. discount_code: The discount was applied by a discount code. manual: The discount was manually applied by the merchant (for example, by using an app or creating a draft order). script: The discount was applied by a Shopify Script.

member.summary: The type of line on the order that the discount is applicable on. Valid values: line_item: The discount applies to line items. shipping_line: The discount applies to shipping lines.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.DiscountTargetType.LineItem
member.summary: line_item: The discount applies to line items.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.DiscountTargetType.ShippingLine
member.summary: shipping_line: The discount applies to shipping lines.

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.DiscountType
member.summary: The type of discount. Default value: fixed_amount. Valid values: fixed_amount: Applies amount as a unit of the store's currency. For example, if amount is 30 and the store's currency is USD, then 30 USD is deducted from the order total when the discount is applied. percentage: Applies a discount of amount as a percentage of the order total. shipping: Applies a free shipping discount on orders that have a shipping rate less than or equal to amount. For example, if amount is 30, then the discount will give the customer free shipping for any shipping rate that is less than or equal to $30.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.DiscountType.FixedAmount
member.summary: fixed_amount: Applies amount as a unit of the store's currency. For example, if amount is 30 and the store's currency is USD, then 30 USD is deducted from the order total when the discount is applied.

member.summary: percentage: Applies a discount of amount as a percentage of the order total.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.DiscountType.Shipping
member.summary: shipping: Applies a free shipping discount on orders that have a shipping rate less than or equal to amount. For example, if amount is 30, then the discount will give the customer free shipping for any shipping rate that is less than or equal to $30.

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.FulfillmentOrderRequestStatus
member.summary: unsubmitted: The initial request status for newly-created fulfillment orders. member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.ProductStatus.Active
member.summary: active: The product is ready to sell and is available to customers on the online store, sales channels, and apps. By default, existing products are set to active.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.ProductStatus.Archived
member.summary: archived: The product is no longer being sold and isn't available to customers on sales channels and apps.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.ProductStatus.Draft
member.summary: draft: The product isn't ready to sell and is unavailable to customers on sales channels and apps. By default, duplicated and unarchived products are set to draft.

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.RestockType
member.summary: How this refund line item affects inventory levels. Valid values: no_restock: Refunding these items won't affect inventory. The number of fulfillable units for this line item will remain unchanged. For example, a refund payment can be issued but no items will be returned or made available for sale again. cancel: The items have not yet been fulfilled. The canceled quantity will be added back to the available count. The number of fulfillable units for this line item will decrease. return: The items were already delivered, and will be returned to the merchant. The returned quantity will be added back to the available count. The number of fulfillable units for this line item will remain unchanged. legacy_restock: The deprecated restock property was used for this refund. These items were made available for sale again. This value is not accepted when creating new refunds.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.RestockType.NoRestock
member.summary: no_restock: Refunding these items won't affect inventory. The number of fulfillable units for this line item will remain unchanged. For example, a refund payment can be issued but no items will be returned or made available for sale again.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.RestockType.Cancel
member.summary: cancel: The items have not yet been fulfilled. The canceled quantity will be added back to the available count. The number of fulfillable units for this line item will decrease.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.RestockType.Return
member.summary: return: The items were already delivered, and will be returned to the merchant. The returned quantity will be added back to the available count. The number of fulfillable units for this line item will remain unchanged.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.RestockType.LegacyRestock
member.summary: legacy_restock: The deprecated restock property was used for this refund. These items were made available for sale again. This value is not accepted when creating new refunds.

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.ShipmentStatus
member.summary: The current shipment status of the fulfillment. Valid values: label_printed: A label for the shipment was purchased and printed. label_purchased: A label for the shipment was purchased, but not printed. attempted_delivery: Delivery of the shipment was attempted, but unable to be completed. ready_for_pickup: The shipment is ready for pickup at a shipping depot. confirmed: The carrier is aware of the shipment, but hasn't received it yet. in_transit: The shipment is being transported between shipping facilities on the way to its destination. out_for_delivery: The shipment is being delivered to its final destination. delivered: The shipment was succesfully delivered. failure: Something went wrong when pulling tracking information for the shipment, such as the tracking number was invalid or the shipment was canceled.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.ShipmentStatus.LabelPrinted
member.summary: label_printed: A label for the shipment was purchased and printed.

member.summary: attempted_delivery: Delivery of the shipment was attempted, but unable to be completed.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.ShipmentStatus.ReadyForPickup
member.summary: ready_for_pickup: The shipment is ready for pickup at a shipping depot.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.ShipmentStatus.Confirmed
member.summary: confirmed: The carrier is aware of the shipment, but hasn't received it yet.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.ShipmentStatus.InTransit
member.summary: in_transit: The shipment is being transported between shipping facilities on the way to its destination.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.ShipmentStatus.OutForDelivery
member.summary: out_for_delivery: The shipment is being delivered to its final destination.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.ShipmentStatus.Delivered
member.summary: delivered: The shipment was succesfully delivered.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.ShipmentStatus.Failure
member.summary: failure: Something went wrong when pulling tracking information for the shipment, such as the tracking number was invalid or the shipment was canceled.

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.TaxType
member.summary: The tax type. Valid values: normal, null, harmonized or compounded. If the value is harmonized, then the tax is compounded of the provincial and federal sales taxes.

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.TrackingCompany
member.summary: The name of the tracking company. When creating a fulfillment for a supported carrier, send the tracking_company exactly as written in the list. If the tracking company doesn't match one of the supported entries, then the shipping status might not be updated properly during the fulfillment process.

member.summary: The status of the transaction. Valid values: pending, failure, success, and error.

member.summary: pending: The transaction is pending.

member.summary: failure: The transaction request failed.

member.summary: Awaiting a response.

member.summary: There was an error while processing the transaction.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.TransactionStatus.Unknown
member.summary: The transaction status is unknown.

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.TransactionType
member.summary:
The transaction's type. Valid values: authorization: Money that the customer has agreed to pay. The authorization period can be between 7 and 30 days (depending on your payment service) while a store waits for a payment to be captured. capture: A transfer of money that was reserved during the authorization of a shop. sale: The authorization and capture of a payment performed in one single step. void: The cancellation of a pending authorization or capture. refund: The partial or full return of captured money to the customer. For more information about Transaction:
Click here for Rest API.
Click here for GraphQL.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.TransactionType.Authorization
member.summary: authorization: Money that the customer has agreed to pay. The authorization period can be between 7 and 30 days (depending on your payment service) while a store waits for a payment to be captured.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.TransactionType.EmvAuthorization
member.summary: emv_authorization: An authorization for a payment taken with an EMV credit card reader.

member.summary: capture: A transfer of money that was reserved during the authorization of a shop.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.TransactionType.Sale
member.summary: sale: The authorization and capture of a payment performed in one single step.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.TransactionType.Void
member.summary: void: The cancellation of a pending authorization or capture.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.TransactionType.Refund
member.summary: refund: The partial or full return of captured money to the customer.

member.name: F:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.TransactionType.Change
member.summary: refund: The money returned to the customer when they've paid too much during a cash transaction.

member.remarks: This field is deprecated since API version 2023-01.

member.summary: The website where the customer clicked a link to the shop.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.Refunds
member.summary: A list of refunds applied to the order.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.SendReceipt
member.summary: Whether to send an order confirmation to the customer. When send_receipt is set to false, then you need to disable the Storefront API from the private app's page in the Shopify admin.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.SendFulfillmentReceipt
member.summary: Whether to send a shipping confirmation to the customer.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.ShippingAddress
member.summary: The mailing address to where the order will be shipped. This address is optional and will not be available on orders that do not require shipping.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.ShippingLines
member.summary: An array of objects, each of which details a shipping method used.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.SourceName
member.summary: Where the order originated. Can be set only during order creation, and is not writeable afterwards. Values for Shopify channels are protected and cannot be assigned by other API clients: web, pos, shopify_draft_order, iphone, and android. Orders created via the API can be assigned any other string of your choice. If unspecified, then new orders are assigned the value of your app's ID.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.SourceID
member.summary: The ID of the order placed on the originating platform. This value doesn't correspond to the Shopify ID that's generated from a completed draft.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.SourceURL
member.summary: A valid URL to the original order on the originating surface. This URL is displayed to merchants on the Order Details page. If the URL is invalid, then it won't be displayed.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.SubTotal
member.summary: The price of the order in the shop currency after discounts but before shipping, taxes, and tips.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.SubTotalSet
member.summary: The subtotal of the order in shop and presentment currencies.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.Tags
member.summary: Tags attached to the order, formatted as a string of comma-separated values. Tags are additional short descriptors, commonly used for filtering and searching. Each individual tag is limited to 40 characters in length.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.TaxLines

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.TaxesIncluded

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.Token

member.summary: The total shipping price of the order, excluding discounts and returns, in shop and presentment currencies. If taxes_included is set to true, then total_shipping_price_set includes taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.TotalTax
member.summary: The sum of all the taxes applied to the order in th shop currency. Must be positive.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.TotalTaxSet
member.summary: The total tax applied to the order in shop and presentment currencies.

member.summary: The transactions of the order

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.DateModifiedAt
member.summary: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the order was last modified. Filtering orders by updated_at is not an effective method for fetching orders because its value can change when no visible fields of an order have been updated. Use the Webhook and Event APIs to subscribe to order events instead.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.UserId
member.summary: The ID of the user logged into Shopify POS who processed the order, if applicable.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.OrderStatusURL
member.summary: The URL pointing to the order status web page, if applicable.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderData.Metafields
member.summary: Attaches additional metadata to a shop's resources: key(required) : An identifier for the metafield(maximum of 30 characters). namespace(required): A container for a set of metadata(maximum of 20 characters). Namespaces help distinguish between metadata that you created and metadata created by another individual with a similar namespace. value (required): Information to be stored as metadata. value_type(required): The value type.Valid values: string and integer. description(optional): Additional information about the metafield.

member.summary: The discount class: PRODUCT: The discount applies to specific products ORDER: The discount applies across all line items.

member.summary: The description of the discount application, as defined by the merchant or the Shopify Script. Available only for manual and script discount applications.

member.summary: The lines on the order, of the type defined by target_type, that the discount is allocated over.

member.summary: The discount application type.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderDiscountApplications.Value
member.summary: The value of the discount application as a decimal. This represents the intention of the discount application. For example, if the intent was to apply a 20% discount, then the value will be 20.0. If the intent was to apply a $15 discount, then the value will be 15.0.

member.summary: The type of the value.

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderDiscountCodes
member.summary: A list of discounts applied to the order. Each discount object includes the following properties: amount: The amount that's deducted from the order total. When you create an order, this value is the percentage or monetary amount to deduct. After the order is created, this property returns the calculated amount. code: When the associated discount application is of type code, this property returns the discount code that was entered at checkout. Otherwise this property returns the title of the discount that was applied. type: The type of discount. Default value: fixed_amount.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderDiscountCodes.Amount
member.summary: The amount that's deducted from the order total. When you create an order, this value is the percentage or monetary amount to deduct. After the order is created, this property returns the calculated amount.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderDiscountCodes.Code
member.summary: When the associated discount application is of type code, this property returns the discount code that was entered at checkout. Otherwise this property returns the title of the discount that was applied.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderDiscountCodes.Type
member.summary: The type of discount. Default value: fixed_amount.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderRisk.CauseCancel
member.summary: Whether this order risk is severe enough to force the cancellation of the order. If true, then this order risk is included in the Order canceled message that's shown on the details page of the canceled order. Note: Setting this property to true does not cancel the order. Use this property only if your app automatically cancels the order using the Order resource. If your app doesn't automatically cancel orders based on order risks, then leave this property set to false.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderRisk.CheckoutId
member.summary: The ID of the checkout that the order risk belongs to.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderRisk.Display
member.summary: Whether the order risk is displayed on the order details page in the Shopify admin. If false, then this order risk is ignored when Shopify determines your app's overall risk level for the order.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderRisk.Id
member.summary: A unique numeric identifier for the order risk.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderRisk.OrderId
member.summary: The ID of the order that the order risk belongs to.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderRisk.Message
member.summary: The message that's displayed to the merchant to indicate the results of the fraud check. The message is displayed only if display is set totrue.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderRisk.Recommendation
member.summary: The recommended action given to the merchant. Valid values: cancel: There is a high level of risk that this order is fraudulent. The merchant should cancel the order. investigate: There is a medium level of risk that this order is fraudulent. The merchant should investigate the order. accept: There is a low level of risk that this order is fraudulent. The order risk found no indication of fraud.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderRisk.Score
member.summary: For internal use only. A number between 0 and 1 that's assigned to the order. The closer the score is to 1, the more likely it is that the order is fraudulent.

member.summary: The transaction's type. Usually a

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderTransaction.ParentId
member.summary: The ID of an associated transaction. For capture transactions, the parent needs to be an authorization transaction. For void transactions, the parent needs to be an authorization transaction. For refund transactions, the parent needs to be a capture or sale transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderTransaction.PaymentID
member.summary: This unique ID is now sent to payment providers when a customer pays at checkout. This ID can be used to match order information between Shopify and payment providers. An Order can have more than one Payment ID. It only includes successful or pending payments. It does not include captures and refunds.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderTransaction.ProcessedAt
member.summary: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when a transaction was processed. This value is the date that's used in the analytic reports. By default, it matches the created_at value. If you're importing transactions from an app or another platform, then you can set processed_at to a date and time in the past to match when the original transaction was processed.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderTransaction.Receipt
member.summary: A transaction receipt attached to the transaction by the gateway. The value of this field depends on which gateway the shop is using.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderTransaction.SourceName
member.summary: [READ-ONLY] The origin of the transaction. This is set by Shopify and can't be overridden. Example values: web, pos, iphone, and android.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderTransaction.Status
member.summary: The status of the transaction. Valid values: pending, failure, success, and error.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderTransaction.AmountToCapture
member.summary: Represents the remaining amount to be captured on the transaction in both shop and presentment money objects with currency. Specifies the available amount with currency to capture on the gateway in shop and presentment currencies. Only available when an amount is capturable or manually mark as paid.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderTransaction.IsTestTransaction
member.summary: Whether the transaction is a test transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderTransaction.UserId
member.summary: The ID for the user who was logged into the Shopify POS device when the order was processed, if applicable.

member.name: P:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.OrderTransaction.Fees
member.summary: The transaction fees charged on the order transaction. Only present for Shopify Payments transactions. (Note: this field is only applicable in GraphQL API)

If this property is specified, then the product page uses a template called "product.suffix.liquid", where "suffix" is the value of this property. If this property is "" or null, then the product page uses the default template "product.liquid". (default: null)

member.name: T:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.FulfillmentData
member.summary: Fulfillment resource can be used to view and manage fulfillments for an order or a fulfillment order. A fulfillment order represents a group of one or more items in an order that will be fulfilled from the same location. A fulfillment represents work that is completed as part of a fulfillment order and can include one or more items.
member.remarks: The Fulfillment resource will be deprecated. Use the FulfillmentOrder resource instead.

member.summary: The uniquely identifying fulfillment name, consisting of two parts separated by a .. The first part represents the order name and the second part represents the fulfillment number. The fulfillment number automatically increments depending on how many fulfillments are in an order (e.g. #1001.1, #1001.2).

member.name: M:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.IShopifyRestClient.Post``2(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,``0,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Post data to Shopify
member.param: The data obj that posts to Shopify API, it should be a T object

True : system will auto convert T data obj to TR response obj first, and then posts to Shopify API; False : system will post T data obj to Shopify API directly. Please follow the Shopify API documents to determine this value, default is true.
member.returns: The response data from Shopify API, it is a TR object

member.name: M:PX.Commerce.Shopify.API.REST.IShopifyRestClient.Put``2(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,``0,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Update data to Shopify
member.param: The data obj that udpates to Shopify API, it should be a T object

True : system will auto convert T data obj to TR response obj first, and then posts to Shopify API; False : system will post T data obj to Shopify API directly. Please follow the Shopify API documents to determine this value, default is true.
member.returns: The response data from Shopify API, it is a TR object

member.name: M:PX.Commerce.Shopify.SPTemplateItemProcessor.DeletedVariantsInExternalSystem(PX.Commerce.Shopify.SPTemplateItemEntityBucket,PX.Commerce.Core.IMappedEntity)
member.summary: When exporting: we need to know which variants must be deleted in the external system. NOTE: Before implementing the import, it was relying on the SKUs to find out which variants must be deleted in Shopify. However, it is not a good idea because if the product already exists in Shopify and does not have any SKUs in the variants, it won't work. Same if we relid on SyncDetails content; if the product exists in Shopify and is about to be exported for the first time from the ERP (merged), then the SyncDetails will be empty and the variants won't be deleted. This new method is looking for the variants that do have a combination of options in the External system but do not exist in the ERP. These varianst (combinations of options) must be deleted in the external system.
member.param: Existing object in the external system.
